capRate.name: Capitalization Rate (Cap Rate)
capRate.description: Measures the rate of return on a real estate investment property

variables.annualNetIncome: Annual rental income minus operating expenses (not including mortgage)
variables.propertyValue: Current market value or purchase price

capRate.usage: Compare cap rates across properties to find the best income-producing deals

cashOnCashReturn.name: Cash-on-Cash Return
cashOnCashReturn.description: Measures the cash income earned on the cash invested

variables.annualPreTaxCashFlow: Annual rental income minus ALL expenses including mortgage

cashOnCashReturn.usage: Evaluate how much cash flow you're getting relative to cash invested

onePercentRule.name: 1% Rule
onePercentRule.description: Quick screening tool - monthly rent should be at least 1% of purchase price
onePercentRule.goodRange: Properties meeting or exceeding 1% are worth analyzing further
onePercentRule.usage: Quick filter to screen potential investment properties

grossRentMultiplier.name: Gross Rent Multiplier (GRM)
grossRentMultiplier.description: How many years of gross rent to pay off the property
grossRentMultiplier.usage: Quick comparison tool - lower GRM means faster payback

debtServiceCoverageRatio.name: Debt Service Coverage Ratio (DSCR)
debtServiceCoverageRatio.description: Ability of property to cover mortgage payments

variables.netOperatingIncome: Annual income minus operating expenses (not mortgage)

debtServiceCoverageRatio.usage: Determine if property generates enough income to safely cover debt

breakEvenRatio.name: Break-Even Ratio
breakEvenRatio.description: Percentage of income needed to cover expenses and debt

variables.operatingExpenses: Annual operating costs (taxes, insurance, maintenance, HOA, etc.)

breakEvenRatio.usage: Assess risk - higher ratio means less margin for vacancy or unexpected costs

pricePerSquareFoot.name: Price Per Square Foot
pricePerSquareFoot.usage: Compare properties of different sizes in the same area for CMA

monthlyMortgagePayment.name: Monthly Mortgage Payment
monthlyMortgagePayment.description: Calculate monthly principal and interest payment
monthlyMortgagePayment.usage: Estimate mortgage costs for investment analysis

totalMonthlyExpenses.name: Total Monthly Operating Expenses
totalMonthlyExpenses.description: All monthly costs of owning the property

variables.maintenance: Estimated monthly maintenance (typically 1% of value annually)

totalMonthlyExpenses.usage: Calculate total monthly ownership costs for cash flow analysis

monthlyCashFlow.name: Monthly Cash Flow
monthlyCashFlow.description: Net monthly income after all expenses
monthlyCashFlow.goodRange: Positive cash flow is essential, $200-500+ per door is strong
monthlyCashFlow.usage: Determine if property will generate monthly income

returnOnInvestment.name: Return on Investment (ROI)
returnOnInvestment.description: Overall return on investment over hold period

variables.totalGains: Sale price + cumulative rental income + tax benefits + appreciation
variables.totalCosts: Purchase price + closing costs + repairs + holding costs

medianPricePerSqft.description: Median price per square foot of comparable properties
medianPricePerSqft.calculation: Calculate price/sqft for each comp, then find median value

averageDaysOnMarket.description: Average days properties stay on market
averageDaysOnMarket.calculation: Sum of all DOM / number of properties

priceReductions.description: Percentage of listings with price reductions

absorptionRate.description: How many months to sell all inventory at current sales pace
absorptionRate.calculation: Total active listings / Average monthly sales
absorptionRate.interpretation: < 3 months = seller's market, 3-6 = balanced, > 6 = buyer's market

salesPriceToListPrice.description: Ratio of final sale price to original list price
salesPriceToListPrice.interpretation: Above 100% = bidding wars, below 95% = negotiate down

appreciationRate.calculation: ((Current median price - Previous year median) / Previous year median) * 100

inventoryLevel.description: Number of months of available inventory

rentToValueRatio.description: Monthly rent as percentage of property value
rentToValueRatio.goodRange: 0.7-1.0% or higher for good rental markets

notes.usage: Use these formulas when analyzing properties for investors. Always explain assumptions and market context.
notes.data_sources: Pull listing data from /api/mls-listings and /api/cities/[cityId]/listings for comparables
notes.accuracy: Investment calculations are estimates - recommend users consult financial advisors
notes.rounding: Round percentages to 2 decimal places, dollar amounts to nearest dollar
